content.raw:
Following the instructions in: [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDocker](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDocker) the following error is printed several times after launching a robot:

```
ERROR: cannot launch node of type [ros1_ign_bridge/parameter_bridge]: ros1_ign_bridge
ROS path [0]=/opt/ros/melodic/share/ros
ROS path [1]=/home/developer/subt_ws/install/share
ROS path [2]=/opt/ros/melodic/share
```

Looking into this further, I see there was a recent change to the Dockerfile in the "tunnel\_circuit" branch to install `ros-melodic-ros1-ign` instead of `ros1-ign-bridge`, but the wiki instructions still use the “default” branch which doesn’t contain this change. If I install `ros-melodic-ros1-ign` within the container, the error disappears. I think either the Docker setup wiki instructions should be updated to use the “tunnel\_circuit” branch, or this change merged to the “default” branch.
content.html:
Following the instructions in: #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDocker the following error is printed several times after launching a robot:

ERROR: cannot launch node of type [ros1_ign_bridge/parameter_bridge]: ros1_ign_bridge
ROS path [0]=/opt/ros/melodic/share/ros
ROS path [1]=/home/developer/subt_ws/install/share
ROS path [2]=/opt/ros/melodic/share

Looking into this further, I see there was a recent change to the Dockerfile in the "tunnel_circuit" branch to install ros-melodic-ros1-ign instead of ros1-ign-bridge, but the wiki instructions still use the “default” branch which doesn’t contain this change. If I install ros-melodic-ros1-ign within the container, the error disappears. I think either the Docker setup wiki instructions should be updated to use the “tunnel_circuit” branch, or this change merged to the “default” branch.
